Free Tools for startups

10 Dec 2022 - Shyam Mohan


Free Tools for Business and Marketing

A. Free Tools for Websites, Logos, Hosting, and Invoicing Software

  • Logaster: Create professional logos online instantly.
  • HTML5 UP: Free responsive HTML5 and CSS3 templates for your website.
  • Bootswatch: A collection of customizable themes for Bootstrap.
  • Templated: 845+ free CSS and HTML5 site templates.
  • WordPress.org WordPress.com: Build your website for free with WordPress.
  • Strikingly: Mobile-optimized website builder with free domains.
  • Withoomph: Beautiful logos designed instantly for your business.
  • Hipster Logo Generator: Generate stylish and trendy hipster logos.
  • Squarespace Free Logo: Download a low-resolution logo for free.
  • Hive: Free unlimited cloud storage for your business needs.
  • Invoice to me: Free invoice generator.
  • Free Invoice Generator: Another option for free invoicing services.
  • Slimvoice: Simple and easy-to-use invoicing tool.

B. Free Business Name Generators

  • The Name App: Find available names for your business or project.
  • Naminum: Discover the perfect name for your company.
  • Short Domain Search: Find short and available single-word domains.
  • Wordoid: Generate catchy names for your business.
  • Hipster Business Name Generator: Get creative and trendy business names.
  • Impossibility: An easy domain name generator.
  • Lean Domain Search: Quickly find domain names for your website.
  • Domainr: Fast and free domain search for short URLs.

C. Writing and Blogging Tools

  • Hemingway: Improve your writing by making it clear and bold.
  • Grammarly: Detect and correct writing mistakes.
  • Medium: Publish and share your stories and ideas.
  • ZenPen: A minimalist writing tool for distraction-free writing.
  • Liberio: Simple eBook creation and publishing tool.
  • Editorial Calendar: Manage your blog posts with a visual calendar.
  • Story Wars: Collaborate and write stories with others.
  • Headline Analyzer: Analyze the emotional marketing value of headlines.
  • WP Hide Post: Control the visibility of items on your WordPress blog.
  • Social Locker: Require social actions to access your premium content.
  • Egg Timer: A simple online countdown timer.

For more tools across categories like SEO, image optimization, social media management, and A/B testing, dive into the wide array of free resources available to help boost your business and marketing efforts.

Here’s the list of color picker tools along with their websites:

B. Free Color Picker Tools

  1. Material Palette: Generate & export your Material Design color palette.
    Website

  2. New Flat UI Color Picker: Best flat colors for UI design.

    Website

    Website

  7. Material UI Colors: Material UI color palette for Android, Web & iOS.
    Website

  8. Colorful Gradients: Gradients automatically created by a computer.
    Website

  9. Adaptive Backgrounds: Extract dominant colors from images.
    Website

  10. Brand Colors: Colors used by famous brands.
    Website

    Website

    Website

    Website

    Website

Here’s a list of products with their websites that focus on organization and collaboration:

  1. Trello: trello.com - Keeps track of everything.
  2. Evernote: evernote.com - The workspace for your life’s work.
  3. Dropbox: dropbox.com - Free space up to 2GB.
  4. Yanado: yanado.com - Tasks management inside Gmail.
  5. WeTransfer: wetransfer.com - Free transfer up to 2GB.
  6. Drp.io: drp.io - Free, fast, private, and easy image and file hosting.
  7. Pocket: getpocket.com - View later, put it in Pocket.
  8. Mailtoself: mailtoself.com - An iOS extension to mail notes to yourself from any app.
  9. List.ly: list.ly - Discover and create great lists.

Here’s a list of products focused on learning, along with their websites:

  1. Skillshare: skillshare.com - Unlock your creativity with free online classes & projects.
  2. Khan Academy: khanacademy.org - Free, world-class education for anyone, anywhere.
  3. Coursera: coursera.org - Free online classes from 80+ top universities & organizations.
  4. Codecademy: codecademy.com - Learn to code interactively, for free.
  5. How to Start a Startup: howtostartastartup.org - As an audio podcast or online course.
  6. Startup Notes: startupnotes.com - Startup School invites amazing founders to tell their story.
  7. The How: thehow.com - Learn from entrepreneurs.
  8. Launch This Year: launchthisyear.com - Guide to help you launch your online business.
  9. Closed Club: closedclub.com - Browse shut-down start-ups & learn why they closed down.
  10. Startup Talks: startuptalks.com - A curated collection of startup-related videos.
  11. Rocketship.fm: rocketship.fm - Learn from successful entrepreneurs each week.
  12. reSRC.io: resrc.io - All free programming learning resources.

Here’s a list of newsletters that focus on various topics, along with their websites:

  1. Email1K: email1k.com - A free 30-day course to double your email list.
  2. Design for Hackers: designforhackers.com - 12 weeks of design learning, right in your inbox.
  3. Startup Digest: startupdigest.com - Personalized newsletter for all things startup in your area.
  4. Mattermark Daily: mattermark.com/daily - Curated newsletter from investors & founders.
  5. ChargeWhatYou’reWorth: chargewhatyoureworth.com - Free course on charging what you’re worth.
  6. Product Psychology: productpsychology.com - Lessons on user behavior.
  7. UX Newsletter: uxnewsletter.co - Tales of researching, designing, and building.
  8. UX Design Weekly: uxdesignweekly.com - Best user experience design links every week.

Here’s a list of useful tools with their websites:

  1. Foundrs: foundrs.co - Co-founder equity calculator.
  2. Ad Spend Calculator: adspendcalculator.com - Should my startup pay to advertise?
  3. HowMuchToMakeAnApp: howmuchtomakeanapp.com - Calculate the cost of a mobile application.
  4. App vs. Website: appvswebsite.com - Should you build an app or website?
  5. Pitcherific: pitcherific.com - Helps you create, train, and improve your pitch.
